p.s: The given text is an excerpt of the novel The Hate U Give which was written 2017 by Angie Thomas.
The excerpt is from chapter 24 pp. 328 - 332 and shows at which point Starr decides to finally speak up and raise her voice in order to peacefully get justice for Khalil's murder.
After the grand jury returned the verdict that Officer Cruise is not to be indicted, Starr, Seven, DeVante and Chris want to help Starr's father, Maverick, to protect his store.
On the way they see a large crowd of protestors gathered on Carnation, where Khalil was shot dead.
Holding a bullhorn and leading the chant Ms. Ofrah, Starr's attorney passionately fights in peace for justice.
As soon as Ms. Ofrah sees Starr she encourages Starr to use her most effective weapon.
Starr grabs the bullhorn climbs onto a car and tells the crowd who she is and what happened.
Encouraged by the whole crowd she uses her voice and explains that Khalil lived and that this is the actual point.
She wants to peacefully fight in this fiery situation against police force and Khalil's murder.
